meta.title: Cloud Basics – Lesson 1: What is Cloud Computing?
meta.description: Learn what cloud computing is, how it works, and why AWS is the most popular cloud platform. This beginner-friendly lesson explains cloud concepts with real-world examples.

hero.heading: What is Cloud Computing?
hero.subheading: Understand the foundation of modern IT using Amazon Web Services
hero.intro: Cloud computing allows you to use powerful servers, storage, and software over the internet instead of owning physical hardware.

sections.title: Understanding Cloud Computing
content: Cloud computing means renting computing power instead of owning it.
You can create servers, databases, and storage instantly over the internet.
You pay only for what you use, which reduces costs and increases flexibility.

sections.title: Real-World Example
content: If you want to run a website, traditionally you must buy a server and install everything.
With AWS cloud, you just click Launch Server and your website is live in minutes.
This saves money, time, and effort.

sections.title: Traditional IT vs Cloud Computing
content: Traditional IT requires large upfront investment.
Cloud uses pay-as-you-go pricing.
Cloud systems scale automatically when traffic increases.
Cloud reduces maintenance and hardware risk.

sections.title: Types of Cloud Services
content: IaaS – Infrastructure as a Service: Example Amazon EC2.
PaaS – Platform as a Service: Example AWS Elastic Beanstalk.
SaaS – Software as a Service: Example Gmail, Zoom.

sections.title: What is AWS?
content: AWS stands for Amazon Web Services.
It is the world’s largest cloud platform.
AWS provides computing, storage, networking, databases, security, and many more services.

sections.title: AWS Global Infrastructure
content: AWS has multiple regions across the world.
Each region has multiple availability zones.
This ensures high availability and disaster recovery.

sections.title: Benefits of Cloud Computing
content: High scalability
Strong security
Global access
Cost efficiency
High performance

sections.title: Cloud in Daily Life
content: Google Drive, WhatsApp, Netflix, and YouTube all run on cloud infrastructure.
Every time you upload or watch a video, you are using cloud computing.

sections.title: Cloud Careers
content: Cloud Engineer
DevOps Engineer
Solutions Architect
Site Reliability Engineer
These roles have high global demand and salaries.

summary: Cloud computing allows you to use IT resources without owning hardware.
AWS is the most powerful cloud platform in the world.
Learning AWS gives you strong career opportunities.
